meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the Greek poet Homer or his works.
meanings.sent1: The students were captivated by the homeric tales of ancient heroes.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed beautiful artifacts from the homeric era.
meanings.sent3: The children put on a homeric play for their parents, complete with makeshift costumes.
meanings.sent4: The homeric descriptions of battles painted vivid pictures in the readers' minds.
meanings.sent5: The homeric style of storytelling has influenced many writers throughout history.

meanings.sent1: The construction of the new skyscraper was a homeric task that took years to complete.
meanings.sent2: The explorer embarked on a homeric journey across the vast desert.
meanings.sent3: The chef prepared a homeric feast for the royal banquet, impressing all the guests.
meanings.sent4: The homeric struggle for freedom resonated with people around the world.
meanings.sent5: The homeric battle between good and evil played out in the pages of the epic novel.
